confession.seduction_date: at time of last wars in Allemaigne
confession.seduction_context: After being raped by 5 soldiers at Liepvre garrison, a man appeared saying he would provide for her needs if she obeyed him

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over a chemise - she claimed they had not returned it and took their best one, falsely claiming it was hers
testimony.threat_quote: it would have been better for him if he had never seen it, and that he would repent 'cent et cent fois'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day became slightly unwell, later in week stopped at point where she had gotten on cart, then became blind and died

testimony.quarrel_subject: His daughter Jeanne suspected Barbelline of making her ill; he threatened her with severe beating if she did not heal her, calling her witch
testimony.threat_quote: he would repent, 'et qu'elle luy feroit seicher comme le bois seichit au bois, et qu'elle le mectroit aussy bas que les cendres du feu'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: on return from Nicolas Houppelin's house became ill, died after 6 weeks
recovered after he made reparation

testimony.quarrel_subject: Refused to let Barbelline stay in their house when la Cordonniere and her daughter were on trial, saying she was frightened of cats

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: started to cry like a pig after Barbelline took it, died of smallpox after illness

testimony.quarrel_subject: Refused to let Barbelline leave her baby on their bed while she went dancing - husband refused permission

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same evening became violently ill, feeling she hated husband and wanted to strangle him, started to vomit, was ill for three weeks

testimony.quarrel_subject: Stopped selling milk to her when his father added 3 cows to his herd and he decided to seek larger profit

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same evening stopped giving milk, subsequently died
subsequently lost all

witnesses.name: Jeannon femme Jean Graniere le jeune

testimony.quarrel_subject: Purchase of butter - she sold 4 pounds to accused, who claimed short weight
testimony.threat_quote: she would make no more butter

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: then her cow died
lost horse - used counter-magic to identify witch, Barbelline appeared

testimony.quarrel_subject: Invited to supper by accused, given soup ingredients (flour, onions, salt, little beef), later reproached witness for saying she made her ill

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: fell ill afterwards, becoming bedridden for 3 months

testimony.quarrel_subject: His wife had beaten her over petty dispute

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: lost horse next day
lost another a year later

testimony.quarrel_subject: When being pursued by La Rose, Barbelline took refuge in their house and La Rose wounded her husband with a sword; husband went to court to recover costs from her
testimony.threat_quote: wished her good night, she replied 'que mal soir puisse elle avoir'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after the malicious good night wish, was never well and lost twin children three weeks beyond half term

witnesses.name: Didielle femme Quentin de Verpelliere
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: stepdaughter of accused (Barbelline's mother was her husband's late wife)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Some quarrel before the death of grandchild

harms_alleged.target: husband's grandchild (from daughter of previous marriage)
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: child fatally burned after Barbelline advised giving drink made with 'barbontine' and asked who was in house when witness went to take husband his dinner

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused drew knife on her mother, had to get two men to watch overnight, split door with axe. When mother ill during wars, accused sold something he had placed on church for safety and never gave reckoning

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: child fatally burned

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband's refusal to continue selling milk

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: subsequent losses

witnesses.name: Jean Grand Remy
witnesses.occupation: chastelain du chateau de la haulte Eschery

witnesses.name: Toussaincte femme Jean de la Voeuvre
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lived with her for a time

testimony.quarrel_subject: Minor quarrel - Barbelline trodden on hands of two small children of witness, hurting them; witness took her before official to obtain recompense

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: soon after legal action, daughter became blind then died
wife became ill and died after a year, losing use of limbs and seeming out of her mind

testimony.quarrel_subject: At haymaking, found daughter of accused spoiling the hay

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after drinking water brought from accused's house, became very ill with headache for 6 weeks, was very hot, could not sleep, seemed insane, thinking she should leave husband and commit some crime

testimony.quarrel_subject: Barbelline angry because not invited to wedding feast
testimony.threat_quote: told her previous wife had not had much health with husband, and she would have no less, and would have no children with him or with others

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: since that time had been in poor health in both body and mind

witnesses.name: Didier Saulcette
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor when she lived at Ste Croix

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: when she lived next to his house lost many animals, though did not know if she was responsible

testimony.quarrel_subject: Asked if she could be godmother suggesting 3 or 4 ecus, he said if child prospered he would want 'gens de bien' to hold it at font
testimony.threat_quote: told him 'que sa femme n'allaiteroit guere d'enfants'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after wife bought pears from accused, fell ill, child born all black, could not feed it, given to nurse but quickly died
two more born but both died within days
same as husband's testimony

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused pulled off small piece of linen wife wore in front of mouth in German fashion, saying she should not hide herself like that when not so cold

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: wife became ill, unable to eat or keep anything down, died after a year, always maintaining Barbelline caused illness

witnesses.name: Urselle fille Michiel Pilmant femme Hans Henry

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: repeated father's story

testimony.quarrel_subject: At Selestat, nouvelle hostesse of Fertrux asked him to look after 3 resaulx of wheat and say he bought one; accused told him she wanted one, knowing he could afford it, otherwise would denounce him to authorities for buying grain for another person

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after argument fell ill, began to recover after obtaining three substances from her house and eating them

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: First interrogation - she denied all charges

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses - denied serious charges, admitted some incidental details

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - confessed to seduction and various maléfices, named accomplices

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence, prescribing that she be strangled after feeling fire

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Interrogation - retracted some confessions, said she confessed more than she committed due to torture constraint

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves further torture while maintaining previous sentence

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Second torture - confessed again to seduction and maléfices when preparations made

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Formal death sentence by burning alive

timeline.subject: Barbelline fille Guillaume Jean Chaperey
timeline.details: Executed by burning alive same day

accomplices_named.name: Augnenesse femme Jean Crepin
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as accomplice in death of Hanry Wiriat's child

accomplices_named.name: widow of le petit Blaise
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as accomplice in death of Hanry Wiriat's child

accomplices_named.name: wife of Jacot Jean Martin alias le Housse
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as responsible for loss of animals by George le Remendeur and giving grease to kill horse of Estienne Delbois

accomplices_named.name: l'Allemande widow of Humbert Charpentier
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as giving powder to poison children of Pierre Charpentier

accomplices_named.name: Demenge le Loup
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as hating clerc juré and involved in poisoning his wife's water

accomplices_named.name: wife of Didier de Mathaincourt
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as another witch at Liepvre

accomplices_named.name: wife of the Rolbier
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as making Anthoine Menginat's wife ill, identified as mistress at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Bastienne Morgande veuve Demenge Ogier
accomplices_named.context: Named under torture as enemy of clerc juré

prior_accusations.context: Executed witch - witnesses mentioned Barbelline wanted to stay in their house when she was on trial
Said she was taken to sabbat by Helaine's daughter Claudatte, who identified unknown woman dancing as Barbelline
When convicted, told clerc juré privately that unknown woman Elizabethe saw dancing was Barbelline
Barbelline's former employer, executed as witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline to Nicolas Marchal
notable_quotes.english: a hundred and a hundred times (he would repent)

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline to Hanry Wiriat
notable_quotes.french: et qu'elle luy feroit seicher comme le bois seichit au bois, et qu'elle le mectroit aussy bas que les cendres du feu
notable_quotes.english: she would make him dry up like wood dries in the wood, and put him as low as the ashes of the fire
notable_quotes.context: Threat after he called her witch and threatened her

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Houpperlin (during beating by Nicolas Marchal)
notable_quotes.french: et qu'il y avoit longtemps, qu'elle estoit sur le rouge papier, et qu'elle seroit la premiere prinse, et que'elle estoit une double sorciere
notable_quotes.english: that it had been a long time that she was on the red paper, and that she would be the first taken, and that she was a double witch
notable_quotes.context: Witness 3 reported this during testimony about Nicolas Marchal beating Barbelline

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline to Didielle femme Pierre Charpentier
notable_quotes.french: que mal soir puisse elle avoir
notable_quotes.english: may she have an evil evening
notable_quotes.context: Malicious response to good night wish

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline to Marguerite Menginat
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle pouvoit bien boire et menger, scavoir des poules et aultres bonnes viandes, avec ce faire une bonne bource si elle pouvoit, et que la precedente femme dudit son marit n'avoit gueres heu de santé avec luy, et qu'elle n'en auroit pas moings, mesme qu'elle n'auroit aulcuns enfants avec luy, ny avec aultres
notable_quotes.english: that she could well drink and eat, chickens and other good meats, and make a good purse if she could, and that the previous wife of her husband had hardly had any health with him, and she would have no less, and would have no children with him, nor with others
notable_quotes.context: Threat/curse about fertility and health, 3 months after marriage

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline to Mathis Bock
notable_quotes.french: que sa femme n'allaiteroit guere d'enfants
notable_quotes.english: that his wife would hardly nurse any children
notable_quotes.context: After he refused to let her be godmother

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline at final interrogation before torture
notable_quotes.french: n'avoir aulcun support pour la revenger, et que pour tout ce que les tesmoings deposent contre elle, n'estoit que par hayne et envie
notable_quotes.english: having no one to support her to avenge her, and that all that the witnesses depose against her was only from hatred and envy

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline at 3 December interrogation
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit confesse davantaige qu'elle n'avoit commis ny perpetué, mais que c'estoit este par la contrainte de la question, et qu'elle n'eust estimé y debvoir avoir tant de personnes contre elle, ce qu'aiant consideré, l'auroit induit a icelles confessions
notable_quotes.english: that she had confessed more than she had committed or perpetrated, but that it was from the constraint of torture, and that she had not thought there would be so many persons against her, which having considered, had induced her to these confessions

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline about sabbat knowledge
notable_quotes.french: elle l'avoit apprin des proces d'aultres sorcieres qui l'auroient cy devant confessé
notable_quotes.english: she had learned it from the trials of other witches who had confessed it before
notable_quotes.context: Explaining how she knew what to confess about sabbat

notable_quotes.speaker: Sieur Aulbald after trial of la Cordonniere
notable_quotes.french: que si ce n'eust este pour l'esgard d'une petite fille qu'icelle detenue avoit qu'il l'eut faict constituer prisonniere pour ledit faict
notable_quotes.english: that if it had not been for regard of a little daughter that the detained woman had, he would have made her a prisoner for the said fact
notable_quotes.context: Colin Symon testimony - official wanted to arrest Barbelline earlier but refrained due to her daughter

relationships.evidence_text: Had married 'ung allemand', with whom she had returned to Ste Croix, but he had gone off to war after 6 months and she had never heard from him since
Her late mother had been his wife - stepfather relationship

relationships.person1: Jeannon femme Jean Graniere le jeune
relationships.evidence_text: Jeannon femme Jean Graniere le jeune

relationships.person1: Toussaincte femme Jean de la Voeuvre
relationships.evidence_text: Toussaincte femme Jean de la Voeuvre
Marguerite femme Anthoine Menginat bourgois et doyen de Ste Croix

relationships.person1: Urselle fille Michiel Pilmant femme Hans Henry
Urselle fille Michiel Pilmant femme Hans Henry

relationships.evidence_text: In September 1596, when they were neighbours
In 1594, when they lived near one another

economic_context.details: Multiple economic tensions: dispute over chemise/shirt; stopped selling milk to her for profit; quarrel over butter weight; owed money to executioner's wife (Sybille); owed money prevented beating when horse lost; commercial disputes at Selestat over grain; sold stepfather's property without reckoning; wanted money to attend wedding feast; house purchase deal fell through

harms_catalog.harm_description: Horse became slightly unwell, later stopped at point where she got on cart, became blind and died; when carcase cut up mark of her hand was visible
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over chemise, he beat her with axe handle, called her witch, made her reparation
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: next day after she got lift on cart
harms_catalog.method_alleged: mark of hand visible on carcase

harms_catalog.harm_description: Child one year old, taken by Barbelline to Nicolas Houppelin's house, became ill on return, died after 6 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Prior quarrel over daughter's illness
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: on return from Nicolas Houppelin's house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: taking child under arm and carrying it

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness, recovered after father made reparation
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Father threatened severe beating if she did not heal daughter, called her witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: Started to cry like a pig after Barbelline took it, died of smallpox
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to let her stay in house during other witch trials

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became violently ill, feeling she hated husband and wanted to strangle him, started to vomit, was ill for three weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to let her leave baby on their bed to go dancing
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cure followed when Barbelline passed in front of her at door twice in quick succession

harms_catalog.harm_description: Stopped giving milk, died; executioner found organs all burned and most flesh was black - 'vraie sortilege'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Stopped selling milk to her for larger profit

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost all the other cows and 4 oxen
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Stopped selling milk

harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over butter purchase - accused claimed short weight, threatened she would make no more butter

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost horse; used counter-magic (white root in flour, beat it) and Barbelline appeared
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Owed her money
harms_catalog.method_alleged: counter-magic ritual caused witch to appear

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill after supper, becoming bedridden for 3 months; started to recover after Barbelline gave her piece of 'bretzelle'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Later reproached witness for saying she made her ill
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after supper with soup ingredients (flour, onions, salt, little beef)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost horse
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Wife had beaten her over petty dispute
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cats got in way of horse and cart, making great noise

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost another horse
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Wife's beating

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost twin children with which she was pregnant, three weeks beyond half term, was never well after
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: When being pursued by La Rose, took refuge in their house; La Rose wounded husband with sword; husband went to court to recover costs from her
harms_catalog.method_alleged: words - wished her 'que mal soir puisse elle avoir' instead of good night

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: husband's grandchild from daughter of previous marriage
harms_catalog.harm_description: Child became ill, was advised to give drink made with 'barbontine', left by fire which was covered, fatally burned
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Some quarrel before
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after advice and asking who was in house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: advice to give 'barbontine', asking who was in house, suspicious timing

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became blind, then died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Barbelline trodden on hands of two small children, witness took her before official to obtain recompense, had to be called three times

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill and died after a year, losing use of limbs and finally seeming out of her mind; told witness she feared Barbelline had given her the illness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Barbelline frequenting house, family complained but could not put her out because owed her money

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became very ill with headache for 6 weeks, was very hot, could not sleep, seemed insane, thinking she should leave husband and commit some crime
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Found daughter of accused spoiling the hay at meadow
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after drinking water brought from accused's house

harms_catalog.harm_description: In poor health in both body and mind since marriage, previous wife had not had much health, cursed to have no children
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Angry because not invited to wedding feast
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 3 months after marriage when Barbelline came to house

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost many animals when she lived next to his house, though did not know if she was responsible
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: when she lived next door at Ste Croix

harms_catalog.harm_description: After wife bought pears from accused, fell ill, child born all black, could not feed it, given to nurse but quickly died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She asked to be godmother suggesting 3 or 4 ecus, he said if child prospered would want 'gens de bien' to hold it at font
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after wife got pears from her and fell ill

harms_catalog.harm_description: Two more born but both died within days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refusal of godmother role, threat that wife would hardly nurse children

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill, unable to eat or keep anything down, died after a year, always maintaining Barbelline caused illness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused pulled off small piece of linen wife wore in front of mouth in German fashion

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill, began to recover after obtaining three substances from her house and eating them
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Argument at Selestat over wheat, threatened to denounce him to authorities
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cure by obtaining three substances from her house suggests she caused it

material_culture.context: Dispute over chemise brought to wash, accused claimed not returned and took best one; seamstress inspected it and said made in Germany
Nicolas Marchal beat her with handle of an axe
Got lift on Nicolas Marchal's cart
Brought sheets to wash made by Nicolas Marchal's wife
Getting milk from George le Remendeur's wife for her child; commercial transaction
Sold 4 pounds to accused, quarrel over weight
Counter-magic: man advised putting white root in sack of flour and beating it to make witch appear
White root in flour for counter-magic; also ingredient for soup
Ingredient for soup given to Marguerite Winssart
Ingredient for soup; also given as healing charm with blessed candle and bread
Little beef in soup ingredients
Piece of 'bretzelle' given to Marguerite Winssart, after eating which she started to recover
Bought from accused by pregnant women; suspected of causing illness/death
Confessed under torture to putting powder in apples to harm victims
Given with bread and salt as healing charm to la musniere
Given with blessed candle and salt as healing charm
Drink made with 'barbontine' advised for sick grandchild
Small piece of linen worn in front of mouth in German fashion, pulled off by accused
Grain purchase at Selestat, commercial dispute
Accused drew knife on her mother
Split door of room with axe during confrontation with mother
La Rose wounded Didielle Charpentier's husband with sword
Told accused some lard she bought was no good
Amount suggested for godmother payment
Mentioned in curse about eating well
Given by accomplice to kill horse under torture confession
Magical powder for poisoning under torture confession

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, where accused lived and most witnesses resided
Where Barbelline went into service at age 15 with wife of prévôt
Location in Allemaigne where prévôt's wife (employer) was executed as witch
Where Barbelline served; where grain dispute occurred; where she and Elizabethe were both serving and quarreled
Germany - where Barbelline served; where chemise was made; where wars occurred; where she married 'ung allemand'
Where Michel Waldrier lived; where accused was living at haymaking time; where Augnenesse femme Jean Crepin lived
Where Didier Saulcette was clerc juré; where his wife Jeannon lived
Where garrison was during last wars; where soldiers raped Barbelline; where wife of Didier de Mathaincourt lived
Where accused sold stepfather's property; where Toussaincte lived; where Michiel Pilmant lived; where wife of Pilmant met accused in street
Where Jean Grand Remy was chastelain of chateau
Where Jean Gaulthier lived; where accused had been chased away from and given shelter by Toussaincte
Where Elizabethe fille Lienard le Parmentier lived
Foundry where Quentin de Verpelliere worked
Location of Change de Nancy appellate court
Where Jeannon Saulcette went for haymaking and found daughter of accused spoiling hay
Where Quentin de Verpelliere worked, where wife took him dinner
Where Quentin de Verpelliere placed something for safety during wars
Where Barbelline saw shadowy form when returning from Bergheim

historical_context.military_details: Garrison at Liepvre during last wars in Allemaigne; Barbelline raped by 5 soldiers from garrison; husband went off to war after 6 months; 'year of the wars' when she had bastard daughter; mother ill 'during last wars in Allemaigne'; wind and snow during wars
weather_events: wind and snow forced wife back when taking dinner to husband at foundry
economic_hardship_indicators: lacked money to go to marriage feast
people owed her money preventing them from evicting her
lived as honestly as she could
bastard daughter due to 'meschantes langues' driving husband away
commercial disputes over grain, milk, butter

prior_legal_disputes.description: Executioner's wife beat her and called her witch; they went to court and paid reparation
Nicolas Marchal called her witch; made her reparation
Hanry Wiriat called her witch; made reparation
Toussaincte took her before official to obtain recompense for treading on children's hands
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Had to be called three times, did not appear in person

prior_legal_disputes.description: La Rose pursued Barbelline, wounded Didielle Charpentier's husband with sword when she took refuge in their house; husband went to court to recover costs and lost time from her
Punished by justice for grandchild's fatal burning
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Didielle femme Quentin de Verpelliere was punished

legal_context.redress_outcome: Multiple people paid her reparation for calling her witch

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Initially prescribed she be strangled after feeling fire; later approved burning alive when local court sentenced

hearsay_chains.content: next day daughter said that her mother had been beaten by a big black man
called out during beating that she had long been 'sur le rouge papier' and would be first taken and was a double witch
had several times heard her named as an accomplice
said if not for her little daughter would have made her prisoner
said she was taken to sabbat by Helaine's daughter Claudatte
told him privately that unknown woman Elizabethe saw dancing was Barbelline
told him that when away at foundry accused had drawn knife on her, had to get two men to watch overnight, split door with axe
wife told witness she feared Barbelline had given her the illness
complained of Barbelline but could not put her out because owed her money
warned witness of reputation for witchcraft but suggested concealing from wife

emotional_state_notes: crying when begging to be let in after returning from Bercheny
crying and shouting strangely on way home from veillée with daughter
cries at night were to God to prevent being beaten by master (per confession)
would not perjure herself, they could do what they liked with her but she was no witch
retracted confessions saying done more than committed due to torture constraint

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said Nicolas Marchal's wife had given her the shirt, bringing it to her house

Said of Hanry Wiriot 'qu'elle luy avoit faict beaucoup de plaisir et que presentement luy en donnoit son louyer' - she had done him much pleasure and now he gave her her wages. Claimed he had called her witch and made reparation
Not cause of Jean Graniere's cow death, suspected Jacot le Housse of Ste Croix
Said she had nourished Didielle Charpentier previous year and would have done so again; was not cause of death of her children
Said Helaine Delois had hated her, had thrown burning branch from fire across her fingers, after which she had given her a good beating

third_parties.name: la Cordonniere
third_parties.context: Executed witch; Barbelline asked to stay in Wiriat house when she was on trial, saying frightened of cats

third_parties.name: daughter of la Cordonniere
third_parties.context: Executed witch

third_parties.name: Nicolas Houppelin
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: innkeeper where Mathis Bock lodged; Barbelline took Wiriat child to his house
third_parties.context: Called out during beating that Barbelline had long been 'sur le rouge papier'; his wife warned Mathis Bock of Barbelline's reputation

third_parties.name: La Rose
third_parties.context: Pursued Barbelline, she took refuge in Charpentier house, he wounded husband with sword

third_parties.name: wife of prévôt at Bercheny
third_parties.context: Barbelline's employer when she served at Bergheim age 15; executed as witch; treated Barbelline very badly with daughter

third_parties.name: daughter of wife of prévôt
third_parties.context: Treated Barbelline very badly with mother

third_parties.name: Helaine femme Estienne Delois
third_parties.context: Accused Barbelline; Barbelline said she had thrown burning branch across her fingers

third_parties.name: Claudatte (daughter of Helaine)
third_parties.context: When convicted told clerc juré privately that unknown woman Elizabethe saw dancing was Barbelline

third_parties.name: Elizabethe fille Lienard le Parmentier
third_parties.context: Said taken to sabbat by Claudatte; enemies since both serving at Selestat; Barbelline called her 'larronesse de cousteaux'

third_parties.name: Jacot le Housse (Jacot Jean Martin)
third_parties.context: Barbelline blamed his wife for animals of George le Remendeur

third_parties.name: Corberotte
third_parties.context: Could not put Barbelline out because owed her money

third_parties.name: la musniere
third_parties.context: Came to Barbelline's house after midnight asking her to heal her; Barbelline gave blessed candle, bread, and salt

third_parties.name: Jean Comta
third_parties.context: Mathis Bock bought house from him (in which Barbelline living?); drinking 'vins de marché' when Barbelline warned shutters blown down

third_parties.name: nouvelle hostesse of Fertrux
third_parties.context: Asked Jean Gaulthier to look after 3 resaulx of wheat she bought at Selestat

third_parties.name: bastard daughter of Barbelline
third_parties.context: Born in year of wars, still lived with Barbelline; aged 11 when took water to clerc juré's wife; told neighbors mother beaten by big black man; found spoiling hay by Jeannon Saulcette

third_parties.name: seamstress
third_parties.context: Inspected chemise and said it had been made in Germany, proving Barbelline wrong

third_parties.name: executioner/hangman
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: wife beat Barbelline and called her witch; Barbelline owed him money
third_parties.context: Cut up animals to determine cause of death; his wife beat Barbelline

third_parties.name: man who gave counter-magic advice
third_parties.context: Advised Estienne Delbois to put white root in flour and beat it to make witch appear

third_parties.name: 5 soldiers at Liepvre garrison
third_parties.context: Raped Barbelline during last wars in Allemaigne per her torture confession

third_parties.name: devil/man who appeared after rape
third_parties.context: Appeared after rape saying she was sad and if she obeyed him would provide for her needs; she agreed

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a detailed trial with 25 witnesses and extensive documentation. Key uncertainties: (1) The exact date of confrontations is marked as '? October 1604' in source - could be late October based on surrounding dates. (2) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: served as domestic, had bastard daughter, lacked money for wedding feast, multiple debts, lived 'as honestly as she could', people she owed prevented eviction, husband left due to 'meschantes langues' rather than providing for family. However, she also had some income (sold grain, people owed her money, provided lodging). (3) Practiced healing assessed as TRUE based on: gave 'chandelle beniste, bread and salt' to la musniere as healing charm; gave 'bretzelle' to cure Marguerite Winssart; advised 'barbontine' drink for sick child; confession about wanting to heal Wiriat child but accomplices refused; Jean Gaulthier recovered after obtaining 'three substances from her house'. Category: charms_amulets. (4) Change de Nancy ruling: Initially prescribed strangling after feeling fire (22 Nov), but final sentence was burning alive (10 Dec) - local court did NOT follow appellate court's more lenient modification. (5) Formal accuser: Set to null as this was not a partie formelle case but rather informations preparatoires initiated by authorities based on accumulated reputation and prior accusations. (6) Multiple accomplices named under torture but most accusations retracted or modified in subsequent interrogations - Barbelline explicitly stated she confessed more than she committed due to torture and learned sabbat details from other trials. (7) The trial shows significant legal complexity with multiple retractions, renewed confessions under threat of torture, and ultimate execution despite Change de Nancy's modification prescribing a more merciful death.
